metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4352 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the demuxer function in libmpdemux/demux_gif.c in Mplayer allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via large dimensions in a gif file. It was discovered that MPlayer incorrectly handled certain gif files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4352` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mencoder - 2:1.2.1-1ubuntu1.1
mplayer - 2:1.2.1-1ubuntu1.1
mplayer-gui - 2:1.2.1-1ubuntu1.1
mplayer2 - 2:1.2.1-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mplayer package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.2.1-1ubuntu1.1').
